Technique: FORMED BY HAND; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Atmataka
Description: This shabti in faience was discovered in a pyramid at Nuri. The statuette, which bears the hieroglyphic text from Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead is in the name of Atmataka, wife of king Aramatelqa. She is wearing a long wig crowned with the skin of a vulture. In her hands, she holds a pair of hoes. The left shoulder supports a square sack suspended by a cord.
